The first thing you need to do to get started with R and RStudio is to install them on your computer. R works on pretty much every platform available, including the widely available Windows, Mac OS X, and Linux systems.

## Install R and RStudio on Windows

#### Step 1

Go to [here](https://cran.r-project.org/)  and click on the **Download R for Windows** link.

![](/images/install/i1.png)



#### Step 2

Click on the base subdirectory link or install R for the first time link.

![](/images/install/i2.png)

#### Step 3

Click Download R X.X.X for Windows (X.X.X stand for the latest version of R. eg: 4.1.1). At the moment of writing (16 August 2021), R 4.1.1 is the latest version. Choose the most recent one. 

This save the executable .exe file.

![](/images/install/i3.png)



### Step 2

Run	the	installer. Default	settings	are	fine. Without	this,	you	will	not	be	able	to	install RStudio and 	additional packages	later.

## Install R Studio

### Step 3

Download RStudio: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/

### Step 4



Remember, you must have R already installed before installing Rstudio.
